Tesla board convenes special committee to review Elon Musk's pay package . No decision has been made on the form or size of any new equity grant, sources say . Any new pay package would hinge on Tesla meeting ambitious operational, financial and share-price targets . In 2018, shareholders approved a performance-based plan valued at $56 billion .  A revamped CEO package could reshape Tesla's incentive structure, impact share count and test investors' appetite for high-stakes governance decisions . Investors should be alert to how this committee balances performance hurdles with shareholder expectations .

Five companies with a stock market value of at least $1 billion have moved their legal home out of Delaware since last year . Tesla made a high-profile move to Texas last year and in April, PresidentDonald Trump’s social media company Trump Media & Technology, which owns the Truth Social platform, moved to Florida .  Less than an hour after the ruling, Musk said on X: “Never incorporate your company in the state of Delaware.” Trump Media, which is controlled by a trust that owns shares on behalf of President Trump, said in its March proxy statement that Delaware's "increasingly litigious environment facing corporations with controlling stockholders has created unpredictability in decision-making"  Simon does not have a controlling shareholder . Roblox says Nevada law provides greater predictability . Delaware gets around a third of its general budget revenue from fees and taxes related to chartering businesses .  Delaware law limits the role of judges in reviewing certain corporate deals . It also limits the scope of so-called "books and records" requests . Despite the recent changes, corporate law in Delaware remains relatively strict when it comes to deals that would likely benefit insiders directly .  In Nevada, the same controlling shareholder deal would likely be protected by a legal standard known as the business judgment rule . Texas amendments to its corporate code are aimed at reducing the threat of shareholder litigation . The plaintiff in the Musk pay case owned just nine shares when he filed suit .  Archer Aviation is considering reincorporating in Texas and reconsidering Delaware . Archer Aviation's general counsel says Delaware judges "have become kind of activist in nature" by appearing to rewrite settled law .
